Review.Titre: 40 bucks a month to create a resume once…
Review.Contenu: This was a supposedly "FREE" Resume app. Just fill out all of your information, create your resume, then get slammed with a charge to download it! Oh, but that's not the best part! If you don't cancel your "membership" after you download your resume, (i.e., the only reason you came here), they'll charge you 40 bucks a month for the privilege of having created a resume once! What a bargain! Stay far away from this predatory site.

I was unaware that this was not free until I was done.  When I typed in free resume in google, this site popped up so I believed this company was the one to work with.  After hours of working on my resume, then they tell me I have to pay.  That shows they care more about money than transparency to consumers, and I can not trust companies like that.  To be clear, I do not mind paying for assistance, but I think it is fair to state that at the beginning and not "dupe" someone into using your site. The only reason I purchased is because of how long I worked on it.I gave two stars instead of one because I liked their pre-typed job descriptions, although there is nothing in that section to help you if you were in the military.

Review.Titre: The template was easy to use and it…
Review.Contenu: The template was easy to use and it helped me create my resume but the intro said it was a free site. I paid $1.95 to access for 14 days and now I have to cancel or my card will be charged $39.99 every 4 weeks!!! I don't mind paying a one time nominal fee but to try to rope a customer into a repeat charge that seems excessive and overpriced made me feel like crap. People that are looking for a job probably don't have $40 to throw away
